article_title: Manomet Gulf station owner offers explanation, apologies
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox.

article_metadata.description: A Plymouth gas station’s owners, Timothy and Maureen Haley of Hanson, were upset about the theft of what they said was a $900 sign. They posted a picture of it on Facebook beneath a handwritten reward offering $1,000 worth of gas for the sign's return and the names of those involved in the theft.Instead of the sign, the Haley’s received a hale storm of criticism and, if the posters are taken at their word, a promise from many of those who commented that they would never buy gas from the Haleys again.
article_metadata.author: Frank Mand fmand@wickedlocal.com
